{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3403718,"name":"James Goebel","username":"RummelRobotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/bc8723/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-30T00:23:08.364Z","cooked":"

I want to use the Pololu
Pololu item #: 4079 300 cm pwm sensor. I have it runing with the sample
arduino code from pololu. I can convert the code in Java but I need to
know what import commands I need to use the sensor on a pwm port.
Thanks.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-06-30T00:23:08.364Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":49.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":468147,"topic_slug":"what-java-import-i-should-use-for-a-pwm-port-and-a-pololu-4079-distance-sensor","display_username":"James Goebel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61778,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-java-import-i-should-use-for-a-pwm-port-and-a-pololu-4079-distance-sensor/468147/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3403768,"name":"Elijah Beard","username":"ebear11","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-30T01:26:44.864Z","cooked":"

While I do not have direct experience with this, one thing you could try is making a PWM object and calling getPulseTimeMicroseconds from it. The description for that sensor list a conversion equation to get you the distance that you can try.

This might help you. The input is on a digital input and not the pwm output ports.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Encoders - Software

Encoders are devices used to measure motion (usually, the rotation of a shaft). Quadrature Encoders - The Encoder Class: WPILib provides support for quadrature encoders through the Encoder class ( ...

You’ll need the DutyCycle class, with the sensor connected to a DIO pin on the RoboRIO. The GetHighTimeNanoSeconds method will return the length of the pulse in nano seconds.

Using the equation in Pololu’s docs, getting the distance should look something like this:

DigitalInput input = new DigitalInput(0); // DIO Port 0
DutyCycle sensor = new DutyCycle(input);

// Getting the distance (mm):
double distance = 4.0 * (sensor.getHighTimeNanoSeconds() - 1e6);
